First, I need to recall what Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome (HLHS) is. HLHS is a congenital heart defect where the left side of the heart is underdeveloped. This includes the left ventricle, aorta, and sometimes the mitral valve. The other options are different conditions. Atrial Septal Defect (ASD) is a hole between the atria. Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD) is a hole between the ventricles. Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF) is a condition with a ventricular septal defect, pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, and right ventricular outflow tract obstruction. Transposition of the Great Arteries (TGA) is when the aorta and pulmonary artery are switched.
